alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:18PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 118 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Haigler, or 14 miles east of Wray, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Laird and Alvin. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 244 and 247. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
